image.altText: An aerial image shows heavily flooded rural areas of Russia

props.synopsis: Parts of South America have upgraded their tsunami threat warnings, while French Polynesia also braces for significant waves as other countries reduce their advice.

title.children: Tsunami warnings still active after Russian earthquake

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Australia will recognise a Palestinian state, it is only a matter of when and how as the PM bides his time waiting for the right moment.

title.children: Australia will recognise Palestinian state, Albanese 'waiting for right moment'

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and US President Donald Trump shake hands.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's latest statement on Gaza suggests the ties binding the US administration and the Netanyahu government may be fraying, ever so slightly, even as Israel tries to downplay it.

title.children: Even Bibi's biggest backer doesn't believe claim of 'no starvation' in Gaza

image.altText: A woman with a baby on her back with a rifle hanging on the wall in the background.

props.synopsis: Americans are being encouraged to have more children by the likes of Donald Trump, JD Vance and Elon Musk. And even though the risks for the poster families of pronatalism are real they are happy to bear them.

title.children: 'A worthwhile way to die': Inside America's pronatalist movement

image.altText: An Aboriginal child's hands playing with a toy tractor in a sandpit.

props.synopsis: As spit hoods are revived, police are handed stronger use-of-force powers and kids are sent to adult watch houses, critics say new data shows governments have abandoned Closing the Gap.

title.children: 'Human rights violation': Expert's grim warning on kids behind bars

image.altText: A house on a rural block.

props.synopsis: Convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson has been barred from selling the home in which she served her relatives a deadly beef Wellington meal so it may be used in future compensation claims by her victims or their families.

title.children: Mushroom murderer Erin Patterson barred from selling Leongatha home

image.altText: A graphic showing a hand holding a phone. It is superimposed on a drawing of Australia and surrounded by social media apps

props.synopsis: Australia is months away from implementing its world-first social media ban for teens. But questions still remain around how the restrictions will work.

title.children: How will the teen social media ban work? Here's what we know

image.altText: A large yellow vehicle, with an oversized tray on its back, travelling on dirt with a steep manmade hill in the background

props.synopsis: Bowen Coking Coal has appointed administrators after failing to negotiate deferment on its coal royalties to the Queensland government.

title.children: About 500 jobs in doubt as coal mine owner enters administration

image.altText: Paul Keating talks while gesturing his hands. An illuminated conference background is behind him.

props.synopsis: The tax office has moved to allay fears powerful individuals are given special treatment, saying it will review how it made a decision to wipe penalties and interest from a company owned by Paul Keating.

title.children: ATO reviewing how it decided to waive $950k owed by former PM's company

image.altText: People stand by the side of the road dressed in Black Sabbath tshirts.

props.synopsis: Fans of Black Sabbath frontman Ozzy Osbourne flocked to the streets of Birmingham in the United Kingdom to pay tribute to the late musician as part of a public procession ahead of his funeral service.

title.children: Ozzy Osbourne fans line Birmingham streets to pay tribute ahead of funeral

image.altText: A fire truck and firefighters.

props.synopsis: A man has been arrested for his alleged role in the December 2024 arson of the Adass Israel Synagogue of Melbourne in the city's inner south-east.

title.children: Overseas links probed in Melbourne synagogue arson attack as man arrested

image.altText: Cost of living image of old hand holding cash with bills, calculator, glasses and cup of tea

props.synopsis: The "trimmed mean" measure of inflation — the Reserve Bank's preferred measure of underlying inflation — has also declined.

title.children: August rate cut 'seems a done deal' amid falling inflation

image.altText: A stylised 3D graphic showing a dotted line connecting Tasmania and Victoria.

props.synopsis: One thing finally unites Labor, the Greens and the new independent members of Tasmania's parliament — frustration over the time allowed to digest a $5 billion investment decision on Marinus Link.

title.children: 'I won't be bullied': Labor leader given a day to support $5 billion Marinus decision

image.altText: Two students hold dusters to erase crosses on a board

props.synopsis: For the roughly one third of students who are falling behind, experts say it's crucial to intervene early and restore confidence.

title.children: 'Smart parents chat to their teacher': Who needs to worry about NAPLAN?

image.altText: Man in suit holding an umbrella with journalists beside him.

props.synopsis: NSW MP Gareth Ward has been taken into custody following his conviction for sexually abusing two young men. A judge has revoked his bail ahead of sentencing.

title.children: MP Gareth Ward jailed ahead of sex crime sentence

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt runs up to kick a goat kid

props.synopsis: A magistrate says the 20-year-old Broken Hill man's violent acts towards animals, which he filmed and shared online, are "offences against the community".

title.children: Man jailed for 'very distressing' animal abuse in social media videos

image.altText: People sitting on lounge chairs under umbrellas at a beach bar.

props.synopsis: Beach bars are set to become permanent at Broadbeach in 2026 but recovery efforts to fix the city's eroded beaches are expected to take years.

title.children: Gold Coast beach bar plan met with warning about further erosion

image.altText: A man carrying a rifle hanging from one hand walks across concrete, with a yellow square added around him.

props.synopsis: Shane Tamura, the gunman who killed four people inside a New York office this week before turning the gun on himself, was carrying a handwritten note in his wallet claiming he had CTE. What does that mean?

title.children: The NYC gunman left a note to 'study my brain' for CTE. What does it mean?

image.altText: People seen at a rally, some have face paint in the shape of the Palestinian flag. There are colourful flags.

props.synopsis: A pro-Palestinian advocacy group march still hopes to cross the Sydney Harbour Bridge this weekend despite court action, as infighting breaks out amongst NSW Labor government ranks.

title.children: Minns criticised by own MPs over opposition to harbour bridge protest

image.altText: A small boy holds a white sack over his right shoulder while people walk past on a dusty road between tents.

props.synopsis: Gazans say they have to risk their lives in the hope of collecting aid at sites run by the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, where nearly 800 people have been shot and killed.

title.children: 'If you're visible, we shoot': The Gazans torn between food or death

image.altText: A man plays the pokies at Mounties club in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The company that owns the most profitable pokie machine club in New South Wales is being taken to the Federal Court by the agency that investigates financial crime.

title.children: Owners of most profitable pokie machine club in NSW taken to court

image.altText: A man in a blue suit with media microphones in front of him.

props.synopsis: The family of a 95-year-old woman who was tasered by a police officer in an aged care home say they are "struggling to come to terms" with the non-custodial sentence.

title.children: Family of 95yo tasered by ex-cop 'struggling' to understand how he can 'walk free'

image.altText: couple carrying moving boxes

props.synopsis: When looking to buy a new home to live in, you might be wondering if it's best to sell your current property first. Both options have advantages and risks, experts explain.

title.children: Should you sell your existing property before buying another?

image.altText: A man and a woman, both wearing blue suits, smile as they hold hands and walk outside a court building

props.synopsis: A court has heard that former MP Annabel Digance and her husband Greg were found guilty by a District Court Judge of blackmailing Premier Peter Malinauskas, but that the charge was dropped in exchange for them agreeing to leave the-then opposition leader alone.

title.children: Former MP who is suing SA Premier found guilty of blackmail, before charges were dropped

image.altText: A picture of Australian National University domestic, family and sexual violence researcher Chay Brown in front of a grey wall.

props.synopsis: Domestic Violence Prevention Minister Robyn Cahill criticised the coroner's recommendations as "uninspiring" when tabling the government's response.

title.children: 'Incredibly painful': DV advocates criticise NT minister's response

image.altText: a man in a suit crossing a road

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man is convicted of using a carriage service to threaten Newcastle NRL player James Schiller, including sending a message telling the athlete to "count his days".

title.children: Death threat sent to Knights player on Instagram earns 20yo a $750 fine

image.altText: An aerial shot of a country town.

props.synopsis: A man has died after the plane he was flying in crashed north of Balranald in New South Wales.

title.children: Man killed in light plane crash in south-west NSW

image.altText: Two blue little penguins under a log.

props.synopsis: A weeding project gives little penguins a helping hand on an island off WA's south coast where an invasive weed can grow up to three times taller than the little birds.

title.children: Little penguins thriving after weedy foe defeated

image.altText: West Coast Eagles players standing following a match, as a presentation goes on

props.synopsis: West Coast chief executive Don Pyke confirms the struggling club will make a formal request for AFL draft assistance after four years in the doldrums.

title.children: Struggling Eagles confirm plea for AFL draft help

image.altText: A group of greyhounds run as one in a pink jersey falls backwards.

props.synopsis: Champion greyhound Raider's Guide died following a race fall in Launceston on Monday night, prompting renewed calls to shut down the industry in Tasmania.

title.children: Renewed calls to end greyhound racing in Tasmania, following champion's death

image.altText: A minibus surrounded by trees and emergency workers.

props.synopsis: Six people are taken to hospital after a minibus rolled 50 metres down an embankment on the way to a wedding.

title.children: Groom one of two critical after minibus crash in Hunter Valley

image.altText: Education building with TAFE signage.

props.synopsis: The planned cuts of around 100 non-teaching jobs at TAFE NSW has been announced despite the Minns Labor government adding 500 positions to the institution since 2023.

title.children: Third NSW government agency this past week flags job cuts

image.altText: Two men sit on a stage wearing t-shirts and jeans.

props.synopsis: Atlassian co-founder Scott Farquhar believes Australia can become one of the world's major data centre hubs, powered by renewable energy.

title.children: Atlassian founder spruiks Australian data centre hub

image.altText: A male cassowary and two checks crossing a busy road

props.synopsis: Far North Queensland drivers were warned with flashing signs triggered by approaching cassowaries in a bid to save them from being hit.

title.children: Cassowary road deaths fall in innovative camera trial

image.altText: Australian-made rocket crashes shortly after launch

props.synopsis: Gilmour Space Technologies attempted to launch its rocket from a spaceport in the north Queensland community of Bowen in an Australian-first on Wednesday morning.

title.children: Australian-made rocket crashes after attempted north Queensland launch
